message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: // Assuming obj is your JSONObject
Iterator<String> keys = obj.keys();
while(keys.hasNext()) {
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = obj.getJSONArray(key);
    for(int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
        String value = values.getString(i);
        System.out.println("Value is --> " + value);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator to iterate over the keys of the JSONObject. Then, for each key, you can get the corresponding JSONArray using getJSONArray(key) method. Finally, you can iterate over the values of the JSONArray using a for loop and retrieve each value using getString(i) method.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: // Assuming obj is your JSONObject
Iterator<String> iter = obj.keys();
while (iter.hasNext()) {
  String key = iter.next();
  JSONArray values = obj.getJSONArray(key);
  for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
    String value = values.getString(i);
    System.out.println("Key is --> " + key);
    System.out.println("Value is --> " + value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator to iterate over the keys of the JSONObject. Then, for each key, you can use getJSONArray() to get the corresponding array of values. Finally, you can iterate over the values array and extract each value using getString().

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: while (iter.hasNext()) {
  String key = (String) iter.next();
  JSONArray values = obj.getJSONArray(key);
  for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
    String value = values.getString(i);
    System.out.println("Value is --> " + value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator to iterate over the keys of the JSONObject. Then, for each key, you can get the corresponding JSONArray using getJSONArray(key) and iterate over its elements to get the values.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: //obj - has this JSON.
Iterator<String> iter = obj.keys();
while(iter.hasNext()){
  String key = iter.next();
  JSONArray valueArray = obj.getJSONArray(key);
  for(int i=0; i<valueArray.length(); i++){
    String value = valueArray.getString(i);
    System.out.println("Value is --> "+value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the `getJSONArray` method to retrieve the JSONArray associated with a key in the JSONObject. Then, you can iterate over the elements of the JSONArray to extract the values.

        String value = values.getString(i);
        System.out.println("Value is --> " + value);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are trying to directly access the JSONArray using the getJSONArray() method. However, you need to iterate through the keys of the JSONObject and then get the corresponding JSONArray for each key. Then, you can iterate through the values of the JSONArray to get the desired values.
